<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.44  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B>THE COCA-COLA COMPANY  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B> SEVERANCE PAY PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=3><B>AS AMENDED AND RESTATED<BR>
EFFECTIVE MAY 1, 2003  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=727292,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KI3053A.;2',USER='JBELANG',CD='19-FEB-2007;23:01' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_article_1_purpose_and_adoption_of_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 1<BR>  <U>PURPOSE AND ADOPTION OF PLAN</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Coca-Cola Company established The Coca-Cola Company Severance Pay Plan (the "Plan") effective as of January&nbsp;1, 1993 to provide
benefits to certain eligible employees of the Company who were terminated by the Company. The Company now amends and restates the Plan effective May&nbsp;1, 2003. The Plan shall be an unfunded
severance pay plan that is a welfare plan as such term is defined by the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, ("ERISA"), the benefits of which shall be paid solely from the
general assets of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_article_2_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 2<BR>  <U>DEFINITIONS</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this Plan, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Affiliate</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any corporation or other business organization in which the Company owns, directly or
indirectly, 20% or more of the voting stock or capital at the relevant time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Cause</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a violation of the Company's Code of Business Conduct or any other policy of the Company or an
Affiliate, or gross misconduct. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>CCE</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means Coca-Cola Enterprises&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Committee</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee appointed by the Senior Vice President,
Human Resources, which shall act on behalf of the Company to administer the Plan as provided in Article&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Company</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Coca-Cola Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Consideration Period</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the period given to a Participant to consider whether to sign the release and
agreement required under Section&nbsp;3.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Disability or Disabled</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a condition for which a Participant becomes eligible for and receives a
disability benefit under the long term disability insurance policy issued to the Company providing Basic Long Term Disability Insurance benefits pursuant to The Coca-Cola Company Health
and Welfare Benefits Plan, or under any other long term disability plan that hereafter may be maintained by the Company or any Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>International Service Employee</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an employee of the Company or any Affiliate who is classified as an
International Service Employee on the Company's personnel and payroll systems. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Participant</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an
active, regular, full-time salaried employee of the Company or a Participating Affiliate who works primarily within the United States (one of the fifty
states or the District of Columbia), or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
the time period of May&nbsp;1, 2003 through December&nbsp;31, 2003 only, an active, regular, part-time salaried employee of the Company who works
primarily within the United States, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an
active, regular, full-time salaried International Service Employee. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, the term "Participant" shall not include any employee covered by a collective bargaining agreement between an employee representative and the Company or
any Affiliate, unless otherwise provided in the collective bargaining agreement. Further, the term "Participant" shall not include any employee who is designated as hourly by the Company (or to the
extent applicable, any Affiliate) on its payroll, personnel and benefits system. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
individual shall be treated as an "employee" for purposes of this Plan for any period only if (i)&nbsp;he is actually classified during such period by the Company (or to the extent
applicable, any Affiliate) on its payroll, personnel and benefits system as an employee, and (ii)&nbsp;he is paid for services rendered during such period through the payroll system, as
distinguished from the accounts payable </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=2,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=730318,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>department,
of the Company or the Affiliate. No other individual shall be treated as an employee under this Plan for any period, regardless of his or her status during such period as an employee under
common law or under any statute. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Participating Affiliate</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any Affiliate identified in Appendix&nbsp;A. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Plan</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Coca-Cola Company Severance Pay Plan as set forth in this document and as
hereafter amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Severance Benefits Committee</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the committee appointed by the Senior Vice President, Human Resources to
make certain determinations with regard to benefits payable under Article&nbsp;3 and claims under Article&nbsp;5 of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Substantially Equivalent Employment</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a position in the Company or with an Affiliate, or a position with
an entity to whom all or any part of a Company division, subsidiary, or other business segment is outsourced, sold or otherwise disposed (including, without limitation, a disposition by sale of shares
of stock or of assets) that, at the time the employment offer is made: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provides
a principal place of employment of not more than 50 miles from the last principal place of employment with the Company or an Affiliate, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;maintains
the employee's job grade within one level (if new position is with the Company or an Affiliate that uses the same job grades), and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provides
a total cash compensation opportunity consisting of base plus variable compensation, at target performance, that is at least 90% of total cash compensation
opportunity at target performance, of the current position. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Weekly Pay</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means 1/52 of a Participant's annual basic salary (as determined by the Committee) as in effect on
the date the Committee determines that his active employment terminated. For each Participant whose pay depends at least in part on commissions, "Weekly Pay" shall mean his basic
weekly pay rate (as determined by the Committee) as in effect on the date the Committee determines that his active employment terminated, plus the weekly average of his commissions that the Committee
determines that he earned during the calendar year immediately preceding the calendar year in which his active employment terminated. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Years of Service</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
each Participant who is an International Service Employee, the Participant's full and continuous years of employment as a part-time, regular, hourly or
salaried employee of the Company or any Affiliate, as determined by the Committee based on the Company's or Affiliate's personnel records; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
each other Participant, the Participant's whole and partial Years of Vesting Service, as defined in the Employee Retirement Plan of The Coca-Cola
Company; provided, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Years
of Service" shall not include any period of employment with the Company or any Affiliate for which the Participant is receiving or previously has received any
severance pay or similar benefits, whether under this Plan or any other plan or arrangement sponsored or paid by the Company or any Affiliate. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_article_3_benefits"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 3<BR>  <U>BENEFITS</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Circumstances in Which Benefits are Payable.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Position
Elimination.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall qualify for a benefit under Section&nbsp;3.3(a) of this Plan as a result of his
involuntary loss of employment with the Company, a Participating </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=3,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=608653,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_3"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Affiliate,
or, solely with respect to an International Service Employee, an Affiliate, if the Severance Benefits Committee in its discretion determines that: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his
employment terminated as a result of a position elimination announced by the Company, a Participating Affiliate, or, in the case of an International Service
Employee, an Affiliate; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he
was not Disabled immediately prior to his termination of employment; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his
termination was unrelated to a sale or other disposition, including outsourcing, of all or any part of a division, subsidiary or other business segment (including,
without limitation, a disposition by sale of shares of stock or of assets) in which he was employed, unless he was not offered Substantially Equivalent Employment with the purchaser, acquirer or
outsource vendor of the division, subsidiary or business segment; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he
failed (as a result of such termination) to qualify for any severance pay (except as provided under this Plan) or other plan or benefit that the Severance Benefits
Committee in its discretion deems to duplicate this Plan and that is sponsored or paid by the Company or any Affiliate; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he
properly, timely and unconditionally executes and does not revoke, the release and, if applicable, an agreement on confidentiality and competition required under
Section&nbsp;3.1(e). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Other
Involuntary Terminations.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant who fails to satisfy the requirements of Section&nbsp;3.l(a) nevertheless shall
qualify for a benefit as a result of his involuntary loss of employment with the Company, a Participating Affiliate, or, solely with respect to an International Service Employee, an Affiliate, if: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his
employment was not terminated for Cause; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he
properly, timely and unconditionally executes, and does not revoke, the release and, if applicable, an agreement on confidentiality and competition required under
Section&nbsp;3.1(e). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
benefit payable under this Section&nbsp;3.1(b) shall equal the Participant's Weekly Pay multiplied by four. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Discretionary
Benefit.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may qualify for a benefit as a result of his involuntary loss of employment with the
Company, a Participating Affiliate or, solely with respect to an International Service Employee, an Affiliate, if: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Severance Benefits Committee acting in its discretion determines that such qualification is in the best interests of the Company; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his
employment was not terminated for Cause; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he
properly, timely and unconditionally executes, and does not revoke, the release and, if applicable, an agreement on confidentiality and competition required under
Section&nbsp;3.1(e). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
benefit payable under this Section&nbsp;3.1(c) shall be determined in the sole discretion of the Severance Benefits Committee on a case-by-case basis and
the Severance Benefits Committee shall not be bound by prior benefit determinations. However, no benefit payable under this Section&nbsp;3.1(c) shall exceed the amount of benefit payable under
3.3(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Factors.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
making the determinations required under this Section&nbsp;3.1, the Severance Benefits Committee shall have the
right to take into account all factors that the Severance Benefits Committee deems relevant under the circumstances. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=4,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=905635,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Release,
Noncompetition and Nondisclosure Form.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participants shall be provided with releases and agreements on confidentiality
and competition that Participants shall be required to properly, timely and unconditionally execute as a condition to qualifying for a benefit under this Plan, and such documents shall set forth the
minimum requirements for a release and an agreement on confidentiality and competition under this Plan. The Severance Benefits Committee, as part of each determination under Section&nbsp;3.1, also
shall determine whether the release for a Participant shall (for reasons sufficient to the Severance Benefits Committee) include requirements in addition to the minimum requirements set forth in the
form and shall revise the form release for such Participant accordingly. The Severance Benefits Committee in its sole discretion shall (for reasons sufficient to the Severance Benefits Committee)
determine whether a Participant is required also to sign an agreement on confidentiality and competition to qualify for a benefit under this Plan. The Severance Benefits Committee, also shall
determine whether the agreements shall contain additional requirements such as, but not limited to, a non-solicitation agreement and a non-disparagement agreement. If a
Participant declines to properly, timely and unconditionally execute the release and, if applicable, an agreement on confidentiality and competition required by the Severance Benefits Committee for
the benefit described in Section&nbsp;3.1(a), (b)&nbsp;or (c), the Participant shall not qualify for any benefit under this Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Circumstances in Which Benefits are Not Payable.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other
provision in this Plan to the contrary, an employee is not entitled to benefits under this Plan if the employee: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;voluntarily
terminates employment, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;prior
to receiving any benefit under the Plan, is offered Substantially Equivalent Employment, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee, with the Company or one
of its Affiliates, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is
offered Substantially Equivalent Employment, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee, in connection with the sale or other disposition, including
outsourcing, of all or any part of a division, subsidiary or other business segment (including, without limitation, a disposition by sale of shares of stock or of assets) in which he was employed, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is
terminated for Cause, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, if a Participant otherwise eligible for benefits under Section&nbsp;3.1, is offered Substantially Equivalent Employment with CCE between May&nbsp;1,
2003 and December, 31, 2003, such Participant will be entitled to benefits under this Plan if he declines such offer of employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Benefit Formula</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Position
Elimination.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant qualifies under Section&nbsp;3.l(a) for a benefit, his benefit under this Plan shall
equal his Weekly Pay multiplied by the service factor set forth in the Severance Table for his tier. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_severance_table"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Severance Table</U>  <BR></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="63%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="19%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B><U>Tier</U></B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B><U>Service Factor</U></B></FONT><BR></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>104 weeks</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>78 weeks</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>52 weeks</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>4 and 5</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>2 weeks for each Year of Service with a minimum service factor of 12 weeks and a maximum service factor of 52 weeks</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Tiers.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of this Section&nbsp;3.3, a Participant shall be assigned to the tier set forth opposite his job grade
(as determined from the Company's or Participating Affiliate's payroll records as of the date his employment terminated) and, if applicable, his status as an elected </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=5,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=741964,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_5"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>corporate
officer of the Company as of the date his employment terminated, under this Section&nbsp;3.3(b): </FONT></P>
</UL>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="63%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B><U>Job Grade</U></B></FONT><BR></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>18 or higher<BR>
17 and elected corporate officer</FONT></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>17 and not an elected corporate officer<BR>

13</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="19%"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>12<BR>

10</FONT></TD>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, a Retail and Attractions employee who is eligible for a benefit under this Plan shall be treated as assigned to Tiers 4 and 5 for purposes of determining
his benefit under this Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Benefit Payment Form.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant qualifies for a benefit under this Plan,
such benefit shall be paid as soon as practicable after his active employment has terminated, and payment shall be made in the discretion of the Severance Benefits Committee either (i)&nbsp;in a
lump sum or (ii)&nbsp;in equal weekly or semi-monthly installments (whichever installment form most closely reflects the Participant's pay period immediately prior to his termination of
employment) over a period commencing with the date on which his employment terminated and extending for the period set forth as the Participant's service factor under Section&nbsp;3.3(a) above;
provided no installments shall be paid over a period that exceeds two years from the date that the Participant's employment terminated. At any time during the period in which a benefit under the Plan
is paid to a Participant in installments, the Participant may elect to terminate the installments and receive the remaining balance of the benefit in a lump sum payment. No interest whatsoever shall
be paid on any benefit under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Withholding.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have the right to take such action as it deems
necessary or appropriate in order to satisfy any federal, state or local income or other tax requirement to withhold or make deductions from any benefit otherwise payable under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Presumed Qualification for Benefits and Obligation to Repay.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the
Consideration Period given to a Participant ends after the date the Company would otherwise commence payment of benefits under this Plan to the Participant under Section&nbsp;3.3, the Company may
commence payment of the benefit to the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.3 during the Consideration Period in the installment form. However, if at the end of the Consideration Period the
Participant has not properly, timely and unconditionally executed the required release and, if applicable, an agreement on confidentiality and competition, his benefit under this Plan shall cease and
the Participant shall return to the Company any benefit payments previously made to him. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=6,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=550901,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Forfeiture of Benefit.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Reemployment.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
a Participant who is entitled to a benefit under the Plan is reemployed by the Company or any Affiliate, his
benefit under the Plan shall cease or be forfeited in accordance with the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant is reemployed prior to receiving any benefit under the Plan, he shall forfeit the entire benefit otherwise payable under the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
he is reemployed after benefit payments have commenced in the form of installments, he shall forfeit any remaining installments otherwise payable on and after the
date he is reemployed. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
he is reemployed after receiving his entire benefit under the Plan in the form of a lump sum, he shall return to the Company that portion of the lump sum equal to the
remaining amount of benefit that would have been payable to him, as of the date he is reemployed, if he had received his Plan benefit in the installment form set forth in Section&nbsp;3.4. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Violation
of Code of Business Conduct or Company Policy.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If, following the determination that a Participant is entitled to a
benefit under the Plan, the Severance Benefits Committee determines that during his employment, the Participant violated the Company's Code of Business Conduct or any other policy of the Company or
Participating Affiliate, all or a portion of his benefit under the Plan shall cease or be forfeited. The Severance Benefits Committee has the sole discretion to determine on a
case-by-case basis the amount of benefits that will be forfeited in accordance with the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant's violation is discovered and verified by the Severance Benefits Committee prior to receiving any benefit under the Plan, he shall forfeit all or a
portion of the benefit otherwise payable under the Plan as determined in the Severance Benefits Committee's discretion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant's violation is discovered and verified by the Severance Benefits Committee after benefit payments have commenced in the form of installments, he shall
forfeit all or a portion of any remaining installments otherwise payable on and after the date such violation is verified, and shall return to the Company all or a portion of the installments already
received as determined in the Severance Benefits Committee's discretion. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant's violation is discovered and verified by the Severance Benefits Committee after receiving his entire benefit under the Plan in the form of a lump
sum, he shall return to the Company all or a portion of the lump sum as determined in the Severance Benefits Committee's discretion. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Disability.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If,
following the determination that a Participant is entitled to a benefit under the Plan, the Participant becomes
Disabled, his benefit under the Plan shall cease or be forfeited in accordance with the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant becomes Disabled prior to receiving any benefit under the Plan, he shall forfeit the entire benefit otherwise payable under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Participant becomes Disabled after benefit payments have commenced in the form of installments, he shall forfeit any remaining installments otherwise payable on
and after the date he becomes Disabled. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.8</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>No Duplication of Benefits.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Severance Benefits Committee determines that
the benefit payable under this Plan to a Participant duplicates (directly or indirectly) any other benefit otherwise payable to such Participant by the Company or any Affiliate (including, without
limitation, any repatriation payment or allowance or any termination indemnity), the Severance Benefits </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=7,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=637842,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_7"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Committee
shall have the right to reduce the benefit otherwise payable under this Plan to the extent deemed necessary to eliminate such duplication. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_article_4_administration"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 4<BR>  <U>ADMINISTRATION</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Committee.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Committee shall be responsible for the general administration of the Plan. As such, the Committee is the "Plan Administrator" and a "named fiduciary" of the Plan (as
those terms are used in ERISA). In the absence of the appointment of a Committee, the functions and powers of the Committee shall reside with the Company. The Committee, in the exercise of its
authority, shall discharge its duties with respect to the Plan in accordance with ERISA and corresponding regulations, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Committee shall establish regulations for the day-to-day administration of the Plan. The Committee and its designated agents shall have the
exclusive right and discretion to interpret the terms and conditions of the Plan and to decide all matters arising with respect to the Plan's administration and operation (including factual issues).
Any interpretations or decisions so made shall be conclusive and binding on all persons. The Committee or its designee may pay the expenses of administering the Plan or may reimburse the Company or
other person performing administrative services with respect to the Plan if the Company or such other person directly pays such expenses at the request of the Committee. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Authority to Appoint Advisors and Agents.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may appoint and employ
such persons as it may deem advisable and as it may require in carrying out the provisions of the Plan. To the extent permitted by law, the members of the Committee and the Severance Benefits
Committee shall be fully protected by any action taken in reliance upon advice given by such persons and in reliance on tables, valuations, certificates, determinations, opinions and reports that are
furnished by any accountant, counsel, claims administrator or other expert who is employed or engaged by the Committee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Compensation and Expenses of Committee.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The members of the Committee shall
receive no compensation for its duties hereunder, but the Committee shall be reimbursed for all reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of its duties, including counsel fees and
expenses. Such expenses of the Committee, including the compensation of administrators, actuaries, counsel, agents or others that the Committee may employ, shall be paid out of the general assets of
the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Records.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall keep or cause to be kept books and records with
respect to the operations and administration of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=8,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=926883,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->
<A NAME="page_kj3053_1_8"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Indemnification of Committee.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company agrees to indemnify and to defend to
the fullest extent permitted by law any employee serving as a member of the Committee and the Severance Benefits Committee or as their delegate(s) against all liabilities, damages, costs and expenses,
including attorneys' fees and amounts paid in settlement of any claims approved by the Company, occasioned by any act or failure to act in connection with the Plan, unless such act or omission arises
out of such employee's gross negligence, willful neglect or willful misconduct. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Fiduciary Responsibility Insurance, Bonding.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Company has not done so,
the Committee may purchase appropriate insurance on behalf of the Plan and the Plan's fiduciaries to cover liability or losses occurring by reason of the acts or omissions of a fiduciary; provided,
however, that such insurance to the extent purchased by the Plan must permit recourse by the insurer against the fiduciary in the case of a breach of a fiduciary duty or obligation by such fiduciary.
The cost of such insurance shall be paid out of the general assets of the Company. The Committee may also obtain a bond covering all of the Plan's fiduciaries, to be paid from the general assets of
the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj3053_article_5_claims_procedure"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj3053_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 5<BR>  <U>CLAIMS PROCEDURE</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Right to File a Claim.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Participant who believes he is entitled to a benefit
hereunder that has not been received, may file&nbsp;a claim in writing with the Severance Benefits Committee. The Severance Benefits Committee may require such claimant to submit additional
documentation, if necessary, in support of the initial claim. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Denial of a Claim.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any claimant whose claim to any benefit hereunder has been
denied in whole or in part shall receive a notice from the Severance Benefits Committee within 90&nbsp;days of such filing or within 180&nbsp;days after such receipt if special circumstances
require an extension of time. If the Severance Benefits Committee determines that an extension of time is required, the claimant will be notified in writing of the extension and reason for the
extension within 90&nbsp;days after the Severance Benefits Committee's receipt of the claim. The extension notice will also include the date by which the Severance Benefits Committee expects to make
the benefit determination. The notice of the denial of the claim will set forth the specific reasons for such denial, specific references to the Plan provisions on which the denial was based and an
explanation of the procedure for review of the denial. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Claim Review Procedure.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A claimant may appeal the denial of a claim to the
Committee by written request for review to be made within 60&nbsp;days after receiving notice of the denial. The request for review shall set forth all grounds on which it is based, together with
supporting facts and evidence that the claimant deems pertinent, and the Committee shall give the claimant the opportunity to review pertinent Plan documents in preparing the request. The Committee
may require the claimant to submit such additional facts, documents or other material as it deems necessary or advisable in making its review. The Committee will provide the claimant a written or
electronic notice of the decision within 60&nbsp;days after receipt of the request for review, except that, if there are special circumstances requiring an extension of time for processing, the
60-day period may be extended for an additional 60&nbsp;days. If the Committee determines that an extension of time is required, the claimant will be notified in writing of the extension
and reason for the extension within 60&nbsp;days after the Committee's receipt of the request for review. The extension notice will also include the date by which the Committee expects to complete
the review. The Committee shall communicate to the claimant in writing its decision, and if the Committee confirms the denial, in whole or in part, the communication shall set forth the reasons for
the decision and specific references to the Plan provisions on which the decision is based. Any suit for benefits must be brought within one year after the date the Committee (or its designee) has
made a final denial (or deemed denial) of the claim. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, any suit for benefits must be brought within two years of the date of termination of active employment.
No claimant may file suit for benefits until exhausting the claim review procedure described herein. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=9,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=1003600,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KJ3053A.;11',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;15:55' -->

NAME="page_kk3053_1_9"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk3053_article_6_amendment_and_termination_of_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 6<BR>  <U>AMENDMENT AND TERMINATION OF PLAN</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Amendment of Plan.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee reserves the right to amend the provisions of
the Plan at any time to any extent and in any manner it desires by execution of a written document describing the intended amendment(s). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Termination of Plan.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have no obligation whatsoever to
maintain the Plan or any benefit under the Plan for any given length of time. The Company reserves the right to terminate the Plan or any benefit option under the Plan at any time by written document. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Inclusion of Participating Affiliates.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Participating Affiliates may
be included for participation in the Plan by written action of the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk3053_article_7_miscellaneous_provisions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk3053_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 7<BR>  <U>MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Plan Is Not an Employment Contract.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan is not a contract of employment,
and neither the Plan nor the payment of any benefits will be construed as giving to any person any legal or equitable right to employment by the Company or any Affiliate. Nothing herein shall be
construed to interfere with the right of the Company of any Affiliate to discharge, with or without cause, any employee at any time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Assignment.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may not assign or alienate any payment with respect
to any benefit that a Participant is entitled to receive from the Plan, and further, except as may be prescribed by law, no benefits shall be subject to attachment or garnishment of or for a
Participant's debts or contracts, except for recovery of overpayments made on a Participant's behalf by this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Fraud.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No payments with respect to benefits under this Plan will be paid if the
Participant attempts to perpetrate a fraud upon the Plan with respect to any such claim. The Committee shall have the right to make the final determination of whether a fraud has been attempted or
committed upon the Plan or if a misrepresentation of fact has been made, and its decision shall be final, conclusive and binding upon all persons. The Plan shall have the right to fully recover any
amounts, with interest, improperly paid by the Plan by reason of fraud, attempted fraud or misrepresentation of fact by a Participant and to pursue all other legal or equitable remedies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Offset for Monies Owed.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benefits provided hereunder will be offset for any
monies that the Committee determines are owed to the Company or any Affiliate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Funding Status of Plan.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benefits provided hereunder will be paid solely
from the general assets of the Company, and nothing herein will be construed to require the Company or the Committee to maintain any fund or segregate any amount for the benefit of any Participant. No
Participant or other person shall have any claim against, right to, or security or other interest in, any fund, account or asset of the Company from which any payment under the Plan may be made. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Construction.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan shall be construed, administered and enforced according
to the laws of the State of Georgia, except to the extent preempted by federal law. The headings and subheadings are set forth for convenient reference only and have no substantive effect whatsoever.
All pronouns and all variations thereof shall be deemed to refer to the masculine, feminine, neuter, singular or plural, as the identity of the person, persons or entity may require. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.7</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><U>Conclusiveness of Records.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The records of the Company with respect to age,
employment history, compensation, and all other relevant matters shall be conclusive for purposes of the administration of, and the resolution of claims arising under, the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>9</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_kk3053_1_10"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Coca-Cola Company has caused this document to be signed by its duly authorized officer, effective as of May&nbsp;1, 2003. </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=11,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=22480,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KK3053A.;5',USER='YLEE',CD='21-FEB-2007;10:02' -->
<A NAME="page_kk3053_1_11"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk3053_appendix_a_participating_affiliates"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk3053_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><U>APPENDIX A</U><BR>  <U>Participating Affiliates</U>  <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rocketcash LLC </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>11</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=12,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=359042,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KK3053A.;5',USER='YLEE',CD='21-FEB-2007;10:02' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_amendment_number_one_to_the_co__ame02505"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER ONE TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY<BR>  SEVERANCE PAY PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Severance Pay Plan (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee (the
"Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_w_i_t_n_e_s_s_e_t_h_"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, The Coca-Cola Company currently maintains the Plan for the benefit of its eligible employees; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;6.1 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan in order to clarify the definitions of "Participant" and "Years of Service" and to clarify the claims procedure. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows, effective as of May&nbsp;1, 2003: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of "Participant" shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Participant</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an
active, regular, full-time salaried or exception hourly employee of the Company or a Participating Affiliate who works primarily within the United States
(one of the fifty states or the District of Columbia), or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
the time period of May&nbsp;1, 2003 through December&nbsp;31, 2003 only, an active, regular, part-time salaried or exception hourly employee of the
Company who works primarily within the United States, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an
active, regular, full-time salaried International Service Employee. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, the term "Participant" shall not include any employee covered by a collective bargaining agreement between an employee representative and the Company or
any Affiliate, unless otherwise provided in the collective bargaining agreement. Further, the term "Participant" shall not include any employee who is designated as hourly by the Company (or to the
extent applicable, any Affiliate) on its payroll, personnel and benefits system. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
individual shall be treated as an "employee" for purposes of this Plan for any period only if (i)&nbsp;he is actually classified during such period by the Company (or to the extent
applicable, any Affiliate) on its payroll, personnel and benefits system as an employee, and (ii)&nbsp;he is paid for services rendered during such period through the payroll system, as
distinguished from the accounts payable department, of the Company or the Affiliate. No other individual shall be treated as an employee under this Plan for any period, regardless of his or her status
during such period as an employee under common law or under any statute. In addition, an individual shall be treated as a "salaried" or "exception hourly" employee for purposes of this Plan only if he
is actually classified during such period by the Company or an Affiliate on its payroll, personnel and benefits system as a salaried or exception hourly employee." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
definition of "Years of Service" shall be amended by restating paragraph&nbsp;(b) in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(b)&nbsp;for
each other Participant, the Participant's whole Years of Vesting Service, as defined in the Employee Retirement Plan of The Coca-Cola Company;
provided," </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;5.1
shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"<U>Right
to File&nbsp;a Claim.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Participant who believes he is entitled to a benefit hereunder that has not been received, may file&nbsp;a
claim in writing with the Severance Benefits Committee. The claim must be filed within one year after the date of the Participant's termination of active employment. The Severance Benefits Committee
may require such claimant to submit additional documentation, if necessary, in support of the initial claim." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=13,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=33710,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KL3053A.;8',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;23:39' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Number One on the date shown below, but effective as of the date indicated above. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
By:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=14,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="9",CHK=869478,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KL3053A.;8',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;23:39' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_amendment_number_two_to_the_co__ame02529"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER TWO TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY<BR>  SEVERANCE PAY PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Severance Pay Plan (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee (the
"Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_w_i_t_n_e_s_s_e_t_h__1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, The Coca-Cola Company currently maintains the Plan for the benefit of its eligible employees; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;6.1 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2004: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
definition of "Committee" shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><U>Committee</U></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee appointed by the Senior Vice President,
Human Resources (or the most senior Human Resources officer of the Company), which shall act on behalf of the Company to administer the Plan as provided in Article&nbsp;4." </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;3.2
shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>"3.2</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Circumstances in Which Benefits are Not Payable.</U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other
provision in this Plan to the contrary, an employee is not entitled to benefits under this Plan if the employee: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;voluntarily
terminates employment, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;prior
to receiving any benefit under the Plan, is offered Substantially Equivalent Employment, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee, with the Company or one
of its Affiliates, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is
offered Substantially Equivalent Employment, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee, in connection with the sale or other disposition, including
outsourcing, of all or any part of a division, subsidiary or other business segment (including, without limitation, a disposition by sale of shares of stock or of assets) in which he was employed, </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is
terminated for Cause, as determined by the Severance Benefits Committee, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;waived
participation in the Plan through any means, or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;has
entered into an individual employment agreement with the Company or a Participating Affiliate (unless such agreement specifically provides for severance benefits to
be paid under this Plan)." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;A
shall be amended by restating it in its entirety substantially in the form attached hereto as reference. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Number Two on the date shown below, but effective as of the date indicated above. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_amendment_number_three_to_the___ame02589"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER THREE TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY<BR>  SEVERANCE PAY PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Severance Pay Plan (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee (the
"Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl3053_w_i_t_n_e_s_s_e_t_h__2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl3053_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, The Coca-Cola Company currently maintains the Plan for the benefit of its eligible employees; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;6.1 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2005: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of "Participant" shall be amended by adding the following new subsection (d): </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"(d)
a regular, full-time salaried employee of the Company or a Participating Affiliate who works primarily within the United States (one of the fifty states or the District
of Columbia) and who is on an approved military leave of absence when his or her position is eliminated pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1(a)." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appendix&nbsp;A
shall be amended by restating it in its entirety substantially in the form attached hereto as reference. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Number Three on the date shown below, but effective as of the date indicated above. </FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=2><A HREF="#toc_kj3053_5">ARTICLE 4 ADMINISTRATION</A></FONT><BR>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company is contingently liable for guarantees of indebtedness owed by third parties in the amount of $270 million. Fixed charges for these contingent liabilities have not been included in the
computation of the above ratios as the amounts are immaterial and, in the opinion of Management, it is not probable that the Company will be required to satisfy the guarantees. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="toc_ko3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements and related prospectuses of The&nbsp;Coca-Cola Company listed below of
our reports dated February&nbsp;20, 2007, with respect to the consolidated financial statements and schedule of The&nbsp;Coca-Cola Company, The&nbsp;Coca-Cola Company
management's assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting of The&nbsp;Coca-Cola
Company, included in this Annual Report (Form&nbsp;10-K) for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 24.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#07ZAA3053_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 24.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kp3053_power_of_attorney"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kp3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW
ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, E. NEVILLE ISDELL, Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company"), do hereby
appoint GARY P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, GEOFFREY J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior
Vice President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful attorneys-in-fact for me and
in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, or any amendment
or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 15th day of February&nbsp;2007. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/ E. Neville Isdell</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Chairman of the Board,<BR>
Chief Executive Officer and Director<BR>
The Coca-Cola Company</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="13",CHK=283067,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KP3053A.;5',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;23:28' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kp3053_power_of_attorney_1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kp3053_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW
ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, GARY P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company"), do hereby appoint E. NEVILLE
ISDELL, Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of the Company, GEOFFREY J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice
President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful attorneys-in-fact for me and in my
name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, or any amendment or
supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 15th day of February&nbsp;2007. </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="13",CHK=352814,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KP3053A.;5',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;23:28' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kp3053_power_of_attorney_2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kp3053_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW
ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, CONNIE D. MCDANIEL, Vice President and Controller of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company"), do hereby appoint E. NEVILLE ISDELL, Chairman
of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of the Company,
GARY P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, GEOFFREY J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice
President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful attorneys-in-fact for me and in my
name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, or any amendment or
supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 15th day of February&nbsp;2007. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/ Connie D. McDaniel</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Vice President and Controller<BR>
The Coca-Cola Company</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2176230",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="13",CHK=362158,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK124:[07ZAB3.07ZAB3053]KP3053A.;5',USER='SCAVALI',CD='20-FEB-2007;23:28' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kp3053_power_of_attorney_3"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kp3053_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW
ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, HERBERT A. ALLEN, a Director of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company"), do hereby appoint E. NEVILLE ISDELL, Chairman of the Board, Chief
Executive Officer and a Director of the Company, GARY P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, GEOFFREY J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of
the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful
attorneys-in-fact for me and in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, or any amendment or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 15th day of February&nbsp;2007. </FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#07ZAA3053_14">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks3053_exhibit_31.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks3053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks3053_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks3053_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
E. Neville Isdell, Chairman, Board of Directors, and Chief Executive Officer of The&nbsp;Coca-Cola&nbsp;Company, certify that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Coca-Cola Company;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
